sense.name: demonstration
sense.commentary: EXHIBITION[+event] Any act of exhibiting something, or putting it on display. Often refers to baseball games, when the games are "just for show."
sense.examples: It was an exhibition of musical skill. Larry's exhibition of strength caused John to flee in terror. The Padres will be playing the Mets in an exhibition game on Thursday.

sense.name: gathering or show
sense.commentary: EXHIBITION[+event] A formal public display of some collection of item, such as works of art. An expo.
sense.examples: The museum organized an exhibition of Impressionist paintings. The cartoonist's works have been put up in an exhibition. Have you seen the Canadian National Exhibition yet?

sense.name: state of being exhibited
sense.commentary: The state of being on display, either in a demonstration or a formal show; a quality that a thing can have. Mostly used in phrases such as "on exhibition" or "in exhibition".
sense.examples: The painting is currently on exhibition. When Larry put his muscles in exhibition, John decided not to fight him.
